headline: Public statement from Hivisasa’s Founder & CEO
author: Omondi Otieno
description: Over the last six years, thousands of talented Hivisasa news writers have tirelessly reported on Kenya’s counties and national politics. Their work helped Hivisasa grow a steady audience of 2 milli...
articleBody: Over the last six years, thousands of talented Hivisasa news writers have tirelessly reported on Kenya’s counties and national politics. Their work helped Hivisasa grow a steady audience of 2 million monthly readers, peaking at 6.1 million. The influence of the platform is demonstrated regularly by the social impact of its original county stories, which drive collective action and civic engagement.

headline: Eliud Kipchoge assures Kenyans of medals in Tokyo Olympics
author: Oliver Peter
description: World marathon record holder Eliud Kipchoge has assured Kenyans of a good show accompanied by medals, during this year’s edition of the Olympics games in Tokyo, Japan.Speaking after being na...
articleBody:
World marathon record holder Eliud Kipchoge has assured Kenyans of a good show accompanied by medals, during this year’s edition of the Olympics games in Tokyo, Japan.

Speaking after being named in Kenya’s Olympics ‘marathon dream team’, Kipchoge said it is an honour being given a node to represent the country in the Olympics, adding that they will work hard to bring home the much needed victory.

“It’s a great honour to represent Kenya again. I want to assure Kenyans and my fans across the world that we shall work hard to ensure that the team achieve what is required. We shall come with medals. I know it is still a long way to go and anything can happen in between but keep us in prayers,” Kipchoge said as quoted by Nation.

Kipchoge who will defending his Olympic title he won in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil in 2016, will lead the men marathon team which consists of Lawrence Cherono and Amos Kipruto, while Titus Ekiru and Dedan Karoki will be on standby.

Kipchoge is the first man to run a 42 kilometer race under 2 hours, after he ran for 1 hour, 59 minutes and 40 seconds during the INEOS 1:59 Challenge in Vienna, Austria last year.

Brigid Kosgei will lead women marathoners together with former London Marathon champion Vivian Cheruiyot, and Ruth Chepng'etich, with Valary Aiyabei and Sally Chepyegon being selected as reservists.

The 2020 Olympics in Tokyo will be the between July 24, and August 09. However, marathon races will be held in the City of Sapporo over concerns of high heat in Tokyo.

headline: Ayub Timbe promises to bring speed to new club Reading FC
author: Oliver Peter
description: Kenyan winger Ayub Masika Timbe is officially a Reading FC player, after joining the English Championship side on Friday, on loan from Chinese League One side Beijing Renhe, until the end of this s...
articleBody:
Kenyan winger Ayub Masika Timbe is officially a Reading FC player, after joining the English Championship side on Friday, on loan from Chinese League One side Beijing Renhe, until the end of this season.

Timbe joined the team nicknamed the Royals after successful trials.

Speaking to Reading FC after his signing, the Kenyan international said his move to the Championship team means progress in his soccer career.

“To me this is a new step, a new challenge. It is a very big step for me,” said the player in clip shared on the team’s Facebook page.

When asked about what he will bring on the table for Reading, the winger said, “I like to bring speed to the team. I am focused more on being efficient,” said the speedy winger.

“Just to let them know that I am very glad to be in this club. I am going to give 100%,” he added.

By joining a team in England, Ayub Timbe follows in the footsteps of Harambee Stars Captain Victor Wanyama who plies his trade with Tottenham Hotspur in the English Premier League (EPL).

headline: Kenya heading towards the right direction, says Arch-Bishop Ogonyo Ngede
author: Oliver Peter
description: Kenyans have been urged to continue praying for the unity of this county, as the date for the 2022 general elections draws nearer.Speaking at the Jomo Kenyatta sports ground in Kisumu on Thu...
articleBody:
Kenyans have been urged to continue praying for the unity of this county, as the date for the 2022 general elections draws nearer.

ADVERTISEMENT

Speaking at the Jomo Kenyatta sports ground in Kisumu on Thursday, Power of Jesus Around the Word Church’s Arch-Bishop Washington Ogonyo Ngede said that the country is headed towards the right direction and that Kenyans should continue praying for the unity of purpose even as the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) continues to take shape.

“This country is heading towards the right direction. We are building bridges of taking us up there (Heaven), not on this world. Continue praying so that Kenya remains one,” said the Clergyman.

He spoke during a meeting to mark 50 years of the Deliverance Church International, presided over by Bishop Mark Kariuki.

Kariuki who based his sermon on the Bible’s book of Joel 2:25 declared that locusts which have invaded several areas of the country should turn and go back to where they came from.

“At the Kenyatta grounds Kisumu Kenya, we raise our fingers and tell all those locusts which have come from Somalia, Ethiopia, Yemen and other places to turn and go back to where they came from in Jesus name,” Bishop Mark Kariuki declared.

headline: Radio Maisha’s Ali Hassan lands top FKF role
author: Oliver Peter
description: Radio Maisha presenter Ali Hassan Kauleni, popularly known as Hassan Mwana wa Ali has landed a role at the Football Kenya Federation (FKF). Kauleni has been appointed a member of the FKF ele...
articleBody:
Radio Maisha presenter Ali Hassan Kauleni, popularly known as Hassan Mwana wa Ali has landed a role at the Football Kenya Federation (FKF).

ADVERTISEMENT

Kauleni has been appointed a member of the FKF election’s board, set to preside over FKF’s repeat elections.

On Tuesday, January 28, 2019, FKF held a special general meeting, where Ali Hassan’s name and those of four other members were unanimously endorsed by the members present.

According to FKF, 80 delegates attended the meeting, among them representatives from the 48 FKF branches across the country, as well as the Kenya Premier League (KPL), National Super League (NSL), Division One League, and representative of the FKF Women Premier League (WPL).

“Members present voted to pass the Board, comprised of Kentice Tikolo, Patrick Mathew Onyango, Ali Hassan Kauleni, Alfred Ndinya and Samuel Karanja,” reads a section of the report on FKF’s website.

Last year, the Sports Disputes Tribunal (SDT) cancelled FKF elections indicating that the previous election’s board was not properly constituted.

"An order that Football Kenya Federation Presidential elections to be held on 7th December 2019 is hereby cancelled," ruled SDT chairman John Ohaga.

At the time of cancellation in early December, FKF had already conducted branch elections, and what was remaining was the national elections.

headline: CS Matiang’i tours Kisumu, announces construction of a security camp
author: Oliver Peter
description: The Cabinet Secretary (CS) for Interior Dr Fred Matiang’i was in Kisumu County’s Muhoroni Constituency on Friday, where he announced the construction of a security camp along the Kisumu-Nandi count...
articleBody:
The Cabinet Secretary (CS) for Interior Dr Fred Matiang’i was in Kisumu County’s Muhoroni Constituency on Friday, where he announced the construction of a security camp along the Kisumu-Nandi county border.

The camp will be built in collaboration between the national government and the Kisumu county government.

Matiang’i was accompanied to Muhoroni by among others, governor Anyang’ Nyong’o.

Nyong’o said that the construction of the camp to be known as Rapid Deployment Unit Camp will start with immediate effect.

“Joining Interior Cabinet Secretary Dr. Fred Matiang'i at the ground inspection of Museum Rapid Deployment Unit Camp whose construction is slated to begin forthwith,” the governor posted on his Facebook page.

According to the county boss, the camp is meant to deal with ethnic clashes along the Kisumu-Nandi border.

“The sporadic ethnic clashes along Kisumu and Nandi border have for a long time heightened tension in the region. To bring this to a halt the national government in collaboration with the county government of Kisumu saw it needful to put up a security camp along the border of the two neighbouring counties in a bid to beef up security in the region,” the first-term County Chief noted in the post.

headline: Kisumu girl who failed to receive calling letter joins form one after Hivisasa coverage
author: Oliver Peter
description: A Kisumu girl who failed to receive a form one calling letter after sitting her KCPE exams in 2019, has since joined form one at the Xaverian Secondary School, Kisumu.On Monday January 20, 2...
articleBody:
A Kisumu girl who failed to receive a form one calling letter after sitting her KCPE exams in 2019, has since joined form one at the Xaverian Secondary School, Kisumu.

Is there a story unfolding in your community? Let Hivisasa know

On Monday January 20, 2020, Charity Faith told Hivisasa how she failed to receive a form one placement letter, even after sitting for her KCPE at Bridge Kigadili Primary School in Nyalenda last year, managing to score 289 marks.

Her mother went ahead to secure a place for her at the Xaverian Secondary school, using the National Education Management Information System (NEMIS) number, and she is now settled in school despite financial difficulties.

In a phone interview with Hivisasa on Tuesday afternoon, Faith’s mother Josephine Onyango confirmed that the 14-year-old girl was admitted in school on Friday, January 24.

“We went and spoke to the Principal who agreed to admit her. We secured some money somewhere and managed to pay half of the fees. The Principal listened to our pleas,” said Onyango.

Onyango who is jobless, continues to appeal to well-wishers to support her daughter’s education.

“She only has one pair of uniform yet she is supposed to have two. She still has no game skit and several text books,” she said.

Faith wants to study hard and become a banker in future.

headline: From house help to top gospel musician: The story of Edith Odhiambo
author: Oliver Peter
description: Edith Adhiambo Odhiambo famously known as Nya Gabby is one of the most popular female gospel musicians in Luo Nyanza. Her hits such as Let me preach (We ya uru mond ayal), What Jesus has pro...
articleBody:
Edith Adhiambo Odhiambo famously known as Nya Gabby is one of the most popular female gospel musicians in Luo Nyanza.

ADVERTISEMENT

Her hits such as Let me preach (We ya uru mond ayal), What Jesus has promised (Gik Ma Yesu Osingo), Were it not for Jesus (Do Onge Yesu), and, Let me sing for Jesus (We awerne Yesu) are not only uplifting, but full of praises to God.

The songs are contained in her first and only album, released in 2016 with a total of seven songs.

“I started singing at an early age but decided to record my songs in 2016, in order to reach many people through my God-given talent,” she said during an interview in Kisumu on Monday evening.

However, what many people do not know is that at one time, she served as a house help to make ends meet.

"It was in 2007 when I had to serve as a house help to make ends meet. I was earning Sh4, 000 per month,” recalled the mother of one.

She got married in 2008, and in 2009 had to serve as a security guard for two security companies to eke out a living after her husband become ill.

Edith believes all she went through was preparing her to serve Christ Jesus through her music.

The renowned musician divulged that she really thanks God for her only son who was born in 2010, two years after she underwent an operation, with the doctor who operated on her saying that she should prepare not to carry a child in her lifetime.

“I went through an operation in 2008 few months before I got married. The doctor told me that one of my tubes was removed, meaning I would never get a child. But look at me now, I have a 10-year-old son. It is by the Grace of God. I thank and appreciate him much for what He did for me,” said the 32-year-old singer.

headline: Bishop Mark Kariuki takes Kisumu by storm, orders locusts to leave
author: Oliver Peter
description: As the government steps up measures to fight desert locusts which have invaded over 8 counties in the country, Deliverance Church International’s Bishop Mark Kariuki is seeking divine intervention ...
articleBody:
As the government steps up measures to fight desert locusts which have invaded over 8 counties in the country, Deliverance Church International’s Bishop Mark Kariuki is seeking divine intervention to drive the insects away.

Speaking during a meeting to mark the Church’s 50 years of existence at the Jomo Kenyatta sports ground in Kisumu on Thursday, Bishop Mark Kariuki said Kenya is not a place for locusts.

Drawing his sermon from the Bible’s book of Joel 2:25, the said the locusts should turn and go back to where they came from.

The verse says, “And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpillar, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you.”

“At the Kenyatta grounds Kisumu Kenya, we raise our fingers and tell all those locusts which have come from Somalia, Ethiopia, Yemen and other places to turn and go back to where they came from in Jesus name,” Bishop Mark Kariuki said amid a chorus of amen from those who attended the meeting.

“We cannot live together with locusts. We refuse,” he added during a sermon themed Restoration and Demonstration.

The locusts started invading sections of the country in December 2019.

They have so far spread in up to 11 counties, among them Mandera, Wajir, Marsabit, Meru, Embu, Isiolo, Laikipia, Samburu and Baringo.

headline: Uhuru promises to invest more in National Police Service
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta has pledged to invest more in the National Police Service to ensure smoother operations. Speaking on Sunday when
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta has pledged to invest more in the National Police Service to ensure smoother operations.

Speaking on Sunday when he officially opened the Ruiru General Service Unit (GSU) Chapel in Kiambu County, Uhuru said that his government has good plans for the police. He noted that he will allocate more resources to the police with the aim of making them perform better at the end of the day.

“The Government will continue to invest in the National Police Service (NPS) to enable it carry out its mandate effectively, President Uhuru Kenyatta has said,” State House tweeted.

He also said that the construction of the chapel is worth celebrating. The head of state added that the church construction shows that the police recognize the role of God in our daily lives.

“Building this chapel is a great achievement. It is also an honour in recognizing that there is one who is greater than all of us, who protects us as we carry out our duties and serve our nation,” President Kenyatta said.

On his part, Interior CS Fred Matiangi said that Uhuru has proven beyond doubt that he wants to transform the security sector of the country. He also said that Kenya is safe because of the reforms made by the government.

“I am aware of the resources you have spent in addressing the spiritual needs of our officers and our people within the framework of the security sector,” CS Matiangi said.

headline: Kisumu musicians challenged to focus on videos to market their songs
author: Oliver Peter
description: Kisumu-based afro pop musician James Ngoje known by stage name Oliver Msanii has urged his colleagues to focus on releasing videos as a strategy to push their music.In an interview in Kisumu...
articleBody:
Kisumu-based afro pop musician James Ngoje known by stage name Oliver Msanii has urged his colleagues to focus on releasing videos as a strategy to push their music.

Is there a story unfolding in your community? Let Hivisasa know

In an interview in Kisumu on Monday, Oliver Msanii said that a video sells an artist much more than an audio.

“When people listen to you, they also want to see you sing. That can be achieved through releasing videos of audio tracks we release as musicians. A video sells a musician much better than an audio,” he said.

His sentiments were echoed by Andrew Ondego, a Kisumu based Radio Presenter.

“Kisumu musicians should work hard towards releasing videos. A video can make one to get a deal that could not be achieved by only having an audio,” said Ondego who hosts the weekly African Flavor show on Kisumu-based Sky FM.

Oliver Msanii joined the Kisumu music scene in 2017, and he already has several songs to his name.

The Umaarufu award winner says his music is now being embraced in various places in the country, more so Mombasa.

His hits include Kazi kwa Bidii, My only One, Party, Go Gaga and Binadamu Story, all of which have video versions.

His latest song is named Ligi Ndogo released last week.

The musician said that he is happy that most musicians in Kisumu continue to embrace having videos now, as compared to when he joined music in 2017.

“I think I have had a positive influence on a majority of Kisumu artists as they now continue to embrace releasing videos. I hope this trend continues,” said the civil engineer.

He has so far worked with several upcoming musicians, among them Pharice Real, Kevo Willis, Dogo Boy, Celine and E’zars.

headline: Woman Rep recounts how she escaped death by a whisker
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Migori Woman Representative Dr Pamela Odhiambo has recounted how she cheated death a year down the line.In an interview with KTN News ‘Beyond the Scars’ talk show on Saturday, Odhiambo said...
articleBody:
Migori Woman Representative Dr Pamela Odhiambo has recounted how she cheated death a year down the line.

In an interview with KTN News ‘Beyond the Scars’ talk show on Saturday, Odhiambo said that she has a million reasons to thank God after she survived the death scare.

She said that she recalls that incident that took away the life of her bodyguard and was left confined in a wheelchair for many months.

The lawmaker said that she will live to thank God for giving her another chance in life.

“If you look at the mangled wreck more so the side where I was, you will figure out what I am talking about, that indeed it was God’s grace that I did not die,” she said.

The legislator now says that she can walk freely without any help from anyone or crutches after nursing wounds for more than a year. Odhiambo was headed to Homa Bay after she received an invitation from her colleague Gladys Wanga when she got involved in a grisly road accident.

headline: Raila is the most suitable candidate for president in this country — Former MP
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) party leader Raila Odinga is the right man to succeed President Uhuru Kenyatta, Former Nominated Senator Paul Njoroge has said.Speaking at a press conference...
articleBody:
Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) party leader Raila Odinga is the right man to succeed President Uhuru Kenyatta, Former Nominated Senator Paul Njoroge has said.

Speaking at a press conference on Sunday, Njoroge praised Odinga saying that he is the best candidate for president while President Uhuru Kenyatta is the suitable candidate for executive Prime Minister.

“Raila is the most suitable candidate for president in this country…Uhuru Kenyatta is also the most suitable executive Prime Minister to finish his projects that he did not do when he was constrained by his deputy,” he stated.

Former Nominated Senator Paul Njoroge has also rubbished claims of Uhuru Kenyatta serving Kenyans for 10 years then later DP Ruto serving for another 10 years claiming that, the promise was just a slip of the tongue.

“Hakuna deni ya 10 years Uhuru and 10 years Ruto…That was a slip of the tongue from the president and it is allowed," he added.

The veteran politician urged President Kenyatta to ask Deputy President William Ruto to come clean on several scandals he has been linked to in the recent past.

headline: Obado receives overwhelming reception, ‘outshines’ other governors in Mombasa
author: Oliver Peter
description: Migori Governor Okoth Obado was on Saturday among the over 20 county chiefs who attended the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) in Mombasa County, presided over by ODM leader Raila Odinga.Oba...
articleBody:
Migori Governor Okoth Obado was on Saturday among the over 20 county chiefs who attended the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) in Mombasa County, presided over by ODM leader Raila Odinga.

Obado seemingly received overwhelming support from the residents who attended the function, with each of his sentiments being met by applause and ululations.

When he rose to speak shortly after his Nyamira counterpart John Nyagarama, Governor Obado was met by cheers from a good chunk of those in attendance.

“When I say BBI, you say Tibim! (Nikisema BBI, mnasema Tibim!”) said the second term governor shortly after being beckoned on to the podium by Mombasa Governor Ali Hassan Joho. The crowd responded to him in a big way as the BBI, Tibim! Chorus took charge.

“First and foremost I have brought you a message and plenty of greetings from Migori County. The people of Migori are saying that this time round they are inside BBI. The Journey is one and we are ready (First and foremost, nimewaletea ujumbe na salamu nyingi kutoka kaunti ya Migori. Wana wa Migori wanasema namna hii, safari hii wako kwa BBI ndani, ndani ndani zaidi. Safari ni moja, na sisi tuko tayari),” said Obado as applause after applause followed him.

headline: Kenya Railways moves to reclaim Pst Ng'ang'a's land, claims he acquired it irregularly
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Controversial preacher James Ng’ang’a of the Neno Evangelism Centre Church is set to lose a land where his church is built in Nairobi.This is after the Kenya Railways Corporation (KRC) revea...
articleBody:
Controversial preacher James Ng’ang’a of the Neno Evangelism Centre Church is set to lose a land where his church is built in Nairobi.

This is after the Kenya Railways Corporation (KRC) revealed its plans to reclaim the piece of land on which the church is constructed.

KRC, in a note released to the media, said that the land does not belong to Neno Evangelism Centre as it had been acquired through illegal means.

Neno Evangelism Centre founder pastor Ng’ang’a has also been directed to surrender all the documents relating to the property.

“You are hereby requested to surrender all documents relating to the irregular allocation of the above referenced property to the corporation,” KRC stated, in a letter seen by Nation.

The corporation has also indicated that it has embarked on a process to recover all the illegally acquired parcels of land in different parts of the nation.

The recovery process is a collaboration between the corporation, Assets Recovery Agency and the Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission (EACC).

Pastor Ng’ang’a has not spoken on the matter after the officials from the corporation visited the church and they were informed that he is away for prayers.

According to Nation, the KRC officers were expected to go back to the church on Sunday to share the information with the pastor before action is taken.

headline: Uhuru throws jab at Kiunjuri during Mt Kenya tour
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta on Saturday hit out at former Agriculture Cabinet Secretary Mwangi Kiunjuri over his performance. Speaking after the commissioning of the New KCC cooling plant in Ka...
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta on Saturday hit out at former Agriculture Cabinet Secretary Mwangi Kiunjuri over his performance.

ADVERTISEMENT

Speaking after the commissioning of the New KCC cooling plant in Kangeta, Igembe Central, President Kenyatta said that Kiunjuri was not performing well in the agriculture docket before he resorted to firing him.

The head of state cited the issue of locust invasion, saying that Former Trade CS Peter Munya has already proven that he is a performer after asking Kenyans not to take pictures of locusts but instead went to the ground and started spraying the insects.

The President noted that he is already impressed with Munya’s swiftness, adding that these are the leaders he wants in his government. The President also said that he does not want government officials to engage in sideshows when they are expected to serve the electorate.

“Within one day a CS I do not wish to name when he was changed, work started being done and not taking of pictures. That is what we want from leaders if you are given a mandate, deliver on it,” President Kenyatta said.

Munya had fired shots at President Kenyatta, saying that he cannot give the leaders from the region orders on who they should endorse or vote for when it comes to the 2022 succession debate. The former CS promised to stand with Deputy President William Ruto to the end after he was shown the door.

headline: Be vigilant on public resources, you will be held accountable, Uhuru tells governors
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta as asked Governors to ensure no public funds are misused in their administration. Speaking at the Wanguru stadium in Kirinyaga, Uhuru warned the county bosses that t...
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta as asked Governors to ensure no public funds are misused in their administration.

Speaking at the Wanguru stadium in Kirinyaga, Uhuru warned the county bosses that they will be sent home if they abuse their offices and engage in acts of graft.

He was making an apparent reference to former Kiambu governor Ferdinand Waititu who was last week impeached by the Senate.

The President retorted that all governors must account for the resources they are given by the people or else they will be punished harshly.

He also asked Members of the County Assemblies (MCAs) to remain vigilant against corrupt governors.

“Be vigilant, you have heard what has happened to to other people, take good care of public resources, and MCAs if you're here, be vigilant. (Muwe chonjo, mumesikia kile kimewafanyikia watu, muchunge mali ya uma, na MCA’s kama mko hapa, mkae chonjo),” Uhuru said, as quoted by Citizen Digita;.

The President also asked the governors linked to corruption not to drag his name into their woes.

He asked the leaders to face the court and defend themselves whenever they are mentioned of graft rather than running to his feet with the hope that their careers will be saved.

The President said that he will not relent when it comes to fighting graft and promised to go to lower levels including officials tasked with handling County Development Funds (CDF).

headline: Uhuru: The biggest legacy I can leave for Kenyans is peace
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta has reiterated that he will not relent in the quest to make Kenya united before he completes his tenure in office.Speaking at Wang'uru Stadium in Kirinyaga County, U...
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta has reiterated that he will not relent in the quest to make Kenya united before he completes his tenure in office.

ADVERTISEMENT

Speaking at Wang'uru Stadium in Kirinyaga County, Uhuru said that he is dedicated to working with other leaders to ensure that Kenyans live in harmony.

The head of state argued that the nation cannot realize any form of transformation if there is no peace, adding that he is ready to make all sacrifices to leave behind a united nation when he retires in 2022.

“The biggest legacy I can leave for Kenyans is peace. Without peace, no tangible development can take place,” he said, as quoted by Daily Nation.

Uhuru also said that his handshake with ODM leader Raila Amolo Odinga was the best thing that has ever happened to Kenya.

The President noted that through his friendship with Raila, Kenyans are living in peace.

“When I cooperated with [Deputy President] William Ruto, there was peace in Kenya. And When I greeted [Raila] Odinga Kenyans are living happily together,” he said.

On the war on corruption, Uhuru said that he will not tolerate any government official misusing county resources.

headline: Raila says Kenya can be great again
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: ODM leader Raila Odinga has said that Kenya can be made great again. Speaking during the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) rally in Kitui on Saturday, Raila said that the recommendations in ...
articleBody:
ODM leader Raila Odinga has said that Kenya can be made great again.

Is there a story unfolding in your community? Let Hivisasa know

Speaking during the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) rally in Kitui on Saturday, Raila said that the recommendations in the BBI report mark the beginning of a new era.

The African Union Special Envoy noted that through the ideologies in the report, the country can realize better governance.

He said that electoral malpractices, corruption and historical injustices are among the issues that the report seeks to address.

"Kenya can be great. You don't have to sit at the banks of Athi and Tana like those who sat on the banks of the river of Babylon and wept when they remembered Zion," Raia said, according to a tweet by Standard.

The former Prime Minister also said that Kenya will no longer suffer because of tribalism and poverty once the BBI report has been fully implemented.

He, however, warned those who have not declared their stand on the BBI report saying that they will be shocked once the effects start being felt in the country.

"The BBI train is saving Kenyans from poverty to richness, tribalism to unity. if you have been left outside woe unto you. (Gari ya moshi ambayo inaitwa BBI inaendelea kutoa Wakenya kwenye ufukara hadi kwa utajiri, ukabila hadi umoja... Kama umebaki nje, shauri yako #BBIInKitui)"

headline: 22-year-old woman isolated after exhibiting symptoms of the deadly coronavirus
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: A 22-year-old woman from Likoni constituency has been quarantined at the Mombasa Hospital after showing signs of the deadly Coronavirus. The Ministry of Health has confirmed the move to isol...
articleBody:
A 22-year-old woman from Likoni constituency has been quarantined at the Mombasa Hospital after showing signs of the deadly Coronavirus.

The Ministry of Health has confirmed the move to isolate the woman, who arrived into the country on January 30 at around 6 am from Guangzhou, China, where she has been pursuing a course in medicine.

The woman reportedly started exhibiting the symptoms while she was still overseas.

The woman, whose real name has not been disclosed, complained about the difficulty in breathing and chest pains. Mombasa County Director of Communication Richard Chacha confirmed that the health facility has taken all the measures to ensure that she is isolated to avoid spreading the virus to other Kenyans.

The woman has been quarantined in a private room at Rehemtullah ward as doctors fight to restore her health status.

"We are not taking any chances," Chacha said.

The doctors at the facility have forwarded her blood samples to Nairobi for screening as well as analysis before any other step can be undertaken. The County's Health Chief Officer Dr Khadija Shikely has asked Kenyans not to spread rumours until the truth is revealed about the condition of the patient.

Shikely also said that the county government has put in place various measures to protect the residents from the spread of the virus. She also said that no family member has been allowed to visit the patient so far.

headline: US ambassador asks leaders not to politicize BBI
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: US Ambassador to Kenya Kyle McCarter has weighed in on the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) debate amid rising political temperatures in different parts of the country.Speaking on Saturday ...
articleBody:
US Ambassador to Kenya Kyle McCarter has weighed in on the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) debate amid rising political temperatures in different parts of the country.

Speaking on Saturday in Bungoma, McCarter asked leaders not to hijack the report for their selfish gains.

The envoy said that some of the leaders want to take advantage of the report to reinvent themselves politically as they plan for 2022.

McCarter said that he is fully behind a people-driven process, adding that unity is important for the realization of a better Kenya.

“The United States expects an honest conversation among all Kenyans and a process that’s not hijacked by a section of politicians,” he said, according to Standard.

The envoy argued that there is a need for an honest discussion on the BBI report if leaders want to transform the nation for the better.

He also said that is normal for leaders to have varied opinions but that should not be the starting point for division among Kenyans.

McCarter pleaded with leaders to root for national unity as the discussion on the implementation of the report continues all the nation.

“Sometimes the conversation may be difficult and the politicians might not agree but that is democracy,” he said, adding the US backs the process to the latter.

headline: DP Ruto mourns William Ntimama’s daughter
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Deputy President William Ruto has mourned Vivian Ntimama who is William Ntimama youngest daughter.In a tweet on Saturday, DP Ruto revealed how saddened he was following the death of Vivian N...
articleBody:
Deputy President William Ruto has mourned Vivian Ntimama who is William Ntimama youngest daughter.

ADVERTISEMENT

In a tweet on Saturday, DP Ruto revealed how saddened he was following the death of Vivian Ntimama.

The second in command praised the late Vivian Ntimama saying that she was a strong-minded, high achiever and driven by cause woman.

"Terribly saddened by the death of Vivian Ntimama, daughter to former minister the late William Ntimama; she was strong-minded, high achiever and driven by a cause," DP Ruto wrote

DP Ruto said that the late Vivian's diligence and work ethic were more pronounced at the ministry of foreign affairs.

"Her diligence and work ethic was more pronounced at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs where she served as a Foreign Service Officer; the country will miss her humility, focus, positive attitude and resilience," He said.

William Ruto has however asked God to grant strength to the family, relatives and friends of the late Vivian Ntimama.

The late Vivian Ntimama succumbed to death following to a heart attack.

headline: Kisumu All Stars concede 21 goals in 9 matches as poor run continues
author: Oliver Peter
description: Kenya Premier League (KPL) side Kisumu All Stars on Saturday lost their 9th consecutive game, after going down 0-2 against AFC Leopards at the Moi stadium in Kisumu.Vincent Oburu put Leopard...
articleBody:
Kenya Premier League (KPL) side Kisumu All Stars on Saturday lost their 9th consecutive game, after going down 0-2 against AFC Leopards at the Moi stadium in Kisumu.

Vincent Oburu put Leopards ahead in the first half, before John Mark Makwata scored in the second half to put the result beyond All Stars under the tutelage of German-based Arthur Opiyo.

Initially, Makwata had lost a penalty.The Kisumu based side is now without a win or a draw in the last nine matches, with the bad run having started against the first-leg match against AFC Leopards on November 24, last year.

On that occasion, Ingwe walked away with a slim 1-0 win. All Stars then lost to Zoo Kericho (3-0), Sofapaka (2-1), Bandari (2-0) Gor Mahia (3-0), Kakamega Homeboyz (4-0), Tusker FC (2-0) and Posta Rangers (2-0) respectively.

In the last 9 matches, the Blue Eagles have conceded 21 goals and managed to score a paltry 1 goal.

The lone goal was scored during a 2-1 defeat against Sofapaka on December 12, 2019. The side remains rooted at position 16 on the KPL log with 8 points after 19 matches, three points ahead of 17th placed Chemelil Sugar.

Chemelil has a game in hand. In total, All Stars team has conceded 33 goals, and scored 7 in return this season.

author: Oliver Peter
description: Nominated Senator Sylvia Kasanga has urged the Ministry of Education in conjunction with the Ministry of Health, to roll out mental health and depression training for teachers, so as to equip them ...
articleBody:
Nominated Senator Sylvia Kasanga has urged the Ministry of Education in conjunction with the Ministry of Health, to roll out mental health and depression training for teachers, so as to equip them with the capacity to handle cases of mental health and depression among pupils.

Speaking in Kisumu on Wednesday, Senator Kasanga said currently, teachers lack the capacity to assist learners as far as mental health and depression issues are concerned.

“Use and abuse of drugs among the youth is among the causes of mental illness starting from that young age. Can the teachers just get trained? I feel that is a hanging fruit that does not cost much,” she said.

She spoke at the Global Programs for Research and Training organisation offices in Kisumu, during a meeting for members of the implementation and resource team for Smart-Dapper (depression and primary partnership for effective research) project.

She is the sponsor of the mental health amendment Bill 2018, that is currently in the National Assembly.

According to Grace Rota who works for the Smart-Dapper project, it is an affiliation of the University of Nairobi and University of California San Francisco, currently undertaking a five-year-study in Kisumu County.

The study which began last year is introducing two mental health care treatments at the Kisumu County Hospital (KCH), namely interpersonal psychotherapy (talk therapy for 12 weeks) and use of a drug used for treating depression.

“What we want to see is which one is the most effective between the talk therapy and the drug,” said Grace.

headline: Kisumu girl who failed to receive form one calling letter appeals for help
author: Oliver Peter
description: A Kisumu girl who did not receive a calling letter to join form one in any school in the country is now appealing for assistance so as to join secondary school.Unlike most of her peers who s...
articleBody:
A Kisumu girl who did not receive a calling letter to join form one in any school in the country is now appealing for assistance so as to join secondary school.

Unlike most of her peers who sat for the Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) last year, Charity Faith never received a calling letter.

The 14-year-old girl said she went to school and was told her calling letter did not come.

“We went to various cyber to search for the letter but it was not available,” said Faith who sat for her KCPE exams at Bridge Kigadili, in Kisumu’s Nyalenda Estate during an interview in Kisumu on Monday.

This writer visited the Ministry of Education’s website on 2020 form one placements, and indeed no calling letter came forth.

Keying in the County, Sub County and index number, the platform does not produce her name, index number, marks, sub-county, school selected to, school category and school type. It is all blank.

Charity Faith scored 298 marks in KCPE. Her dream is to pursue her studies and become a banker.

According to her mother Josephine Onyango, the head of her former school gave them Faith’s National Education Management Information System (NEMIS) number to help them get a school for her.

“The number helped us get a chance at the Xaverian Secondary School last week,” said Josephine.

She says they need Sh20,000 to cater for her daughter’s school fees this year, besides catering for other requirements such as school uniform; an amount they can’t raise.

“We need help in order for her to enrol in school. I have no job while her father is a small scale farmer in Busia,” said the mother.

Faith is the third born in a family of four.

headline: Harambee Starlets midfielder on the verge of joining Atletico Madrid
author: Oliver Peter
description: Kenyan midfielder Vivian Corazone Aquino is on the verge of joining Spanish side Atletico de Madrid’s women team.The Harambee Starlets player is reportedly set to jet out of the country on W...
articleBody:
Kenyan midfielder Vivian Corazone Aquino is on the verge of joining Spanish side Atletico de Madrid’s women team.

The Harambee Starlets player is reportedly set to jet out of the country on Wednesday to sign a two-year-deal with the Spanish Club.

Currently, Aquino plies her trade with Kenya Women Premier League (KWPL) side Gaspo FC.

She says she is looking forward to joining the European based Atletico.

“Every player's dream is to play in Europe and I am not an exception. I have always been dreaming of playing away from Kenya and I thank God I now have the chance to achieve my dream, I am looking forward to a good stay in Spain,” Aquino was quoted by Goal.com.

Last year, the midfielder played a thrilling role as his side finished runners up in the KWPL behind champions Alex Alumira led Vihiga Queens.

She was also part of the Kenya women national team (Harambee Starlets) that beat hosts Tanzania to win last year’s edition of the Council for East and Central Africa Football Associations (CECAFA) women Senior Challenge Cup in Dar es Salaam, in December 2019.

headline: Rhumba artist Eliakim Rogo, Prince Indah set for album launch
author: Oliver Peter
description: Luo rhumba artist Eliakim Rogo is set for his first album launch title Caro Nyathi Nyabodo (Caro the child of Nyabondo), in April this year.The launch will be held at the Mwisho Mwisho Club ...
articleBody:
Luo rhumba artist Eliakim Rogo is set for his first album launch title Caro Nyathi Nyabodo (Caro the child of Nyabondo), in April this year.

The launch will be held at the Mwisho Mwisho Club in Siaya County on April 03, in conjunction with Siaya based Ratego FM. The event will be graced by Ohangla music maestro Prince Indah, in what can be termed as rhumba meeting Ohangla live on stage.

During a phone interview on Sunday, Rogo said that he made a decision to launch his first album in Siaya due to the massive support he received in the County after he released his first song last year.

“I decided to launch the album in Siaya because it is home. I wanted to start home first before moving on to other places like Nairobi. However, most important is that I received overwhelming support in Siaya when I released my first song in August last year,” said Rogo who runs the Sweet Melody Jazz Band.

On why he decided to partner with Prince Indah during the launch, he had this to say, “Prince Indah has a lot of fans, he is doing fine as far as Ohangla music is concerned and then he is a very understanding person whom you can sit down with and have a fruitful discussion,” said the father of three.

Sweet Melody Jazz Band was formed almost a year ago. It consists of over 10 artists. The band’s first album has seven songs, among them Caro Nyathi Nyabando (Caro the child of Nyabondo), Safari yaMapenzi (the journey of love) and Osiepe Maradiera (true friends).

headline: Olunga back to Japan for pre-season training
author: Oliver Peter
description: Harambee Stars striker Michael Olunga had a very good year by any measurable football standards last year, having scored 27 goals for his Japanese side Kashiwa Reysol, alongside being part of the S...
articleBody:
Harambee Stars striker Michael Olunga had a very good year by any measurable football standards last year, having scored 27 goals for his Japanese side Kashiwa Reysol, alongside being part of the Stars squad that represented the country in the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) in Egypt.

His form saw various football fans and analysts in the country among them former Harambee Stars and Gor Mahia forward Peter Dawo, popularly known as Omuga, urge him to ditch Kashiwa this year, and join a competitive league probably in Europe for competitive football action.

The long-legged striker was back in the country in time for the Christmas and New Year celebrations, where he organised the Michael Olunga tournament in Nairobi and Homa Bay counties.

At one time, he told his fans to wait for ‘breaking news’ about his next team, but as things stand, the forward may after all stay at Kashiwa for another year.

On Saturday, Olunga posted several pictures on his social media pages, indicating that he was back in pre-season training with his side, ahead of the 2020 Japanese topflight league which kicks off on February 21, 2020.

Winter vibes, pre-season mode, God's timing is the best," he posted on Facebook.

Having been promoted from the lower league last year, his team will open the topflight league campaign against Sapporo at the Hitachi Kashiwa Stadium on February 22.

headline: Luo Rhumba musician Eliakim Rogo supports Uhuru’s latest order on royalties
author: Oliver Peter
description: High riding Luo Rhumba musician Eliakim Rogo has given a thumbs up to President Uhuru Kenyatta after he gave a direction requiring all Content Service Providers to channel all payments of royalties...
articleBody:
High riding Luo Rhumba musician Eliakim Rogo has given a thumbs up to President Uhuru Kenyatta after he gave a direction requiring all Content Service Providers to channel all payments of royalties through a single, centrally managed account at the Kenya Copyright Board.

While addressing the press in Mombasa on Tuesday, the President said that this will enable oversight by the regulator and ensure that the collection and distribution accounts are easily auditable, which will, in turn, ensure that producers and musicians earn better from their music, and talent for that matter.

In an interview with Hivisasa on Saturday, Rogo said that musicians stand a high chance of earning better from royalties if the order is fully implemented.

“That is a good directive from the President, it will really help us. We have really suffered. Musicians like me who have shows are somehow getting something from their music, what of those who do not have shows? How do they survive?” paused Rogo.

The musician said that organisations charged with the responsibility of collecting royalties on behalf of musicians such as the Performers Rights Society of Kenya (PRISK) and the Music Copyright Society of Kenya (MCSK) have failed due to the meagre amount of money they pay artists every year.

Mid last year, several artists hit out at MCSK for paying them a paltry Sh2,530 as royalties, with a section of musicians among them Rogo deciding to join PRISK which turned out to be a case of out of the frying pan into the fire.

“Recently, PRISK send musicians Sh3,348 with claims that they are interim royalties. It was a case of moving out of the frying pan into the fire,” he said.

Rogo, former gospel rhumba turned Luo rhumba musician is riding high with various hits among them Caro Nyathi Nyabando (Caro the child of Nyabondo), Safari ya Mapenzi (the journey of love) and Osiepe Maradiera (true friends).

headline: Antony ‘Teddy’ Akumu set to become Kenya’s most successful footballer
author: Oliver Peter
description: It is official that former Gor Mahia midfielder Antony ‘Teddy’ Akumu ha...
articleBody:
It is official that former Gor Mahia midfielder Antony ‘Teddy’ Akumu has joined South Africa’s Premier Soccer League (PSL) side Kaiser Chiefs on a three-and-half year deal from Zambian giants Zesco United.

Is there a story unfolding in your community? Let Hivisasa know

A section of soccer analysts in the country among them former Harambee Stars defender James Situma has linked the 27-year-old deep-lying midfielder’s move to Chiefs to his hard work and immense discipline on and off the pitch.

At 27, Akumu is at the peak of his soccer prowess, and he is now set to become the most successful and decorated footballer this country has ever produced in terms of winning league titles in various countries.

For starters, Akumu played for Gor Mahia for four years from 2010, helping K’Ogallo to win two Kenya Premier League titles in 2013 and 2014 before leaving for Sudan’s Al-Hilal Club.

However, his stay in the team was short-lived as he left to sign for Zambian side Zesco United in 2016, winning the Zambian Super League title in 2017, 2018 and 2019.

That makes it five Premier League titles for Akumu in Kenya and Zambia within a span of six years.

His new side Kaiser Chiefs is currently top of the league standings in South Africa with 41 points after 17 matches, 9 points ahead of Mamelodi Sundowns.

Chiefs have a game in hand meaning they stand a high chance of winning the title for the 5th time this year.

If that happens, Akumu will not only become the first Kenyan to play for the club but also to win a league title in Kenya, Zambia and South Africa.

headline: Kipchoge, Bekele set for mouthwatering clash in London
author: Oliver Peter
description: Olympic marathon champion Eliud Kipchoge will go head to head with Ethiopian Kenenisa Bekele in this year's edition of the London marathon.According to organisers, this year's event will be ...
articleBody:
Olympic marathon champion Eliud Kipchoge will go head to head with Ethiopian Kenenisa Bekele in this year's edition of the London marathon.

Is there a story unfolding in your community? Let Hivisasa know

According to organisers, this year's event will be held on Sunday, April 26, in what promises to be a race to the finish line between Kipchoge and Bekele.

In October last year, Kipchoge became the first man in the world to run a marathon under 2 hours, during the INEOS 1:59 challenge in Vienna, Austria.

The Kenyan marathoner ran for 1 hour, 59 minutes and 40 seconds. However, the record was not recognised by the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF), because it was organised outside the body's calendar.

On his part, Bekele is a former 5,000 and 10,000 metres Olympic champion, and his meeting with Kipchoge is expected to be among the most competitive London marathon has ever seen.

He moved over to marathon in 2014.

The Ethiopian says he is looking foward to racing against time, and of course against Kipchoge who has won 11 marathons in his career in 12 attempts.

“I’m looking forward to racing Eliud again. We have had many great battles over the years on the track, roads and cross-country," Bekele is quoted by Reuters.

“He is a special athlete but I feel my win in Berlin proved that I am still capable of winning the biggest races and in world-class times,” added the Ethiopian.

headline: VIDEO: Drama as Moses Kuria is harassed, ejected from BBI rally
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Gatundu south member of parliament Moses Kuria on Saturday caused chaos in Kitui Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) meeting on Saturday.This happened after he was trying to get a seat at the ...
articleBody:
Gatundu south member of parliament Moses Kuria on Saturday caused chaos in Kitui Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) meeting on Saturday.

Is there a story unfolding in your community? Let Hivisasa know

This happened after he was trying to get a seat at the VIP dais after arriving late.

Kitui Governor Charity Ngilu ordered that Gatundu South MP Moses Kuria be ejected from the VIP saying that she would allow President Uhuru to be disrespected.

"Nobody will abuse our President Uhuru Kenyatta and sit in this meeting! Atolewe!" Ngilu shouted.

“Atolewe, aende [Eject him, let him go],” shouted Ngilu as security-men tried to guide Kuria out of the VIP dais.

The lawmaker arrived at the event at around 1:30 p.m when the meeting had already started.

He arrived when Makueni Governor, Kivutha Kibwana, was addressing the gathering.

However, the congregation demanded that the lawmaker should be offered a seat and he was given one behind the Oranga Democratic Movement (ODM) party leader Raila Odinga.

Several leaders from different political factions have since condemned the incident.

The occurence comes after the allies of Deputy President William Ruto vowed to attend all the BBI meeting across the country.

They have, however, been faulting ODM Leaders for allegedly hijacking the report since it was released. They believe that Raila wants to use the report for his selfish gain.

headline: Wetangula urges Mulembe Nation to back BBI
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Ford Kenya leader Moses Wetangula has asked leaders from the Western region to fully back the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) report for the sake of their economic empowerment. Speaking to...
articleBody:
Ford Kenya leader Moses Wetangula has asked leaders from the Western region to fully back the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) report for the sake of their economic empowerment.

Speaking to the journalists in Bungoma Town on Saturday after a meeting with his party members, Wetangula said that the BBI implementation marks the beginning of a new era.

He argued that the region will only be part of the government if the leaders rally behind the report.

The Bungoma Senator also reminded politicians to educate the masses on the report.

He also expressed support for a change of the leadership structure from a pure presidential to a parliamentary system where the pot of Prime Minister will be introduced.

"For us to be able to negotiate anything meaningful for our region, we must be united and move as a team. We engage meaningfully knowing with the BBI there is going to be constitutional change," said Wetangula, in a video shared on Twitter.

"The people of Bungoma and all members of our party have embraced this report. We want to see the country moving to a parliamentary system. We want to see the creation of the position of the Prime Minister, Deputies and above all, we want to see a constitution that holds the country together, a constitution that will never ever again in the history of this nation give or create a situation where one or two communities can load over others and run away with the country," he added.

The remarks came at a time when leaders from different parts of the nation were converging in Kitui for the third BBI rally.

headline: William Ole Ntimama’s daughter Vivian is dead
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Vivian Ntimama, the youngest child of the late cabinet minister William Ole Ntimama is dead.Her elder sister Lydia said that the late Vivian succumbed to death on Friday morning following a ...
articleBody:
Vivian Ntimama, the youngest child of the late cabinet minister William Ole Ntimama is dead.

Her elder sister Lydia said that the late Vivian succumbed to death on Friday morning following a heart attack.

She revealed that the late was preparing herself to go for work when she collapsed and passed away while taking a shower in the bathroom.

Vivian Ntimama worked at an officer at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

“Doctors confirmed that my sister succumbed to heart attack,” said Lydia Ntimama, as quoted by K24.

“Vivian was a hard-working person, It is saddening to lose a sibling. However, I would urge online users who find out about someone’s death to always hold that information until family is informed,” she added
articleBodyHtml:
Vivian Ntimama, the youngest child of the late cabinet minister William Ole Ntimama is dead.

Her elder sister Lydia said that the late Vivian succumbed to death on Friday morning following a heart attack.

She revealed that the late was preparing herself to go for work when she collapsed and passed away while taking a shower in the bathroom.

Vivian Ntimama worked at an officer at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

“Doctors confirmed that my sister succumbed to heart attack,” said Lydia Ntimama, as quoted by K24.

“Vivian was a hard-working person, It is saddening to lose a sibling. However, I would urge online users who find out about someone’s death to always hold that information until family is informed,” she added

headline: Turkana University College principal sent on leave
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Thomas Akuja the principal of Turkana University college has been sent to a compulsory leave to pave way for corruption investigations.The University council revealed that Akuja was connecte...
articleBody:
Thomas Akuja the principal of Turkana University college has been sent to a compulsory leave to pave way for corruption investigations.

Share news tips with us here at Hivisasa

The University council revealed that Akuja was connected with corruption case and misuse of the office.

“The Council of Turkana University College, led by Chairperson Mussolin Kithome, has resolved to send the current principal of Turkana University College, Thomas Akuja, on compulsory leave with immediate effect, to pave way for investigations by the relevant government agencies on allegations of possible corruption and abuse of office at Turkana University College,” said the council’s statement seen by K24 Digital.

Prof. Tom Nyamache has however been appointed as the acting Principal of the institution as from January 30 till February 7.

Prof. Nyamache will hold the position for that period because Dr Fredrick Nyongesa who is supposed to formally hold the seat is currently outside the country.

Turkana University college is a part of Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology, inaugurated on January 27, 2017.

headline: Kalonzo faces backlash over calls for term limits
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Wiper party leader Kalonzo Musyoka’s recent suggestion for the scrapping of the term limits for county bosses has not augured well with a section of leaders from the Eastern region. Led by C...
articleBody:
Wiper party leader Kalonzo Musyoka’s recent suggestion for the scrapping of the term limits for county bosses has not augured well with a section of leaders from the Eastern region.

Led by Chama Cha Uzalendo National Organising Secretary Davis Musau, the leaders have said that the Former Vice President errored to make such a proposal in a country where a shortage of leaders is not a problem.

Musau said that the remarks of the Ukambani Political kingpin were not reasonable considering the spirit of democracy. The leaders said that the idea of governors being given another chance.

“Scrapping the governors' term limit would work against those aspiring for the seat since the incumbents would use resources at their disposal to block rivals,” Musau said.

Musau’s remarks were echoed by Machakos County Kanu Secretary Peter Kioko. Kioko argued that governors should not be allowed to remain in office the way African leaders have been used to doing in the past.

Musau said that there is no way we can retain governors who have been linked to graft at the county levels and expected anything positive from them the longer they remain in office.

headline: Bus ferrying passengers to Kitui BBI meeting swept into a river
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: A bus ferrying 45 passengers to Kitui Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) meeting has been swept into a river.Mbooni East Sub-County Police Commander Agnes Omojong' has confirmed that no one w...
articleBody:
A bus ferrying 45 passengers to Kitui Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) meeting has been swept into a river.

Mbooni East Sub-County Police Commander Agnes Omojong' has confirmed that no one was injured.

"I can confirm that all the people have been accounted for, no injuries but I can't tell whether they were headed to BBI rally in Kitui, I just know they were passengers," said Ms Omojong'.

Kisau Kiteta MCA Wambua Masavu confirmed to Standard Digital that the bus was one of the vehicles hired to ferry people to the BBI rally at Kitui Stadium.

The bus was carried by the water after the river banks broke on Friday night.

More to follow ...

headline: Korando and Kogony residents appeal for construction of Nawa Bridge
author: Oliver Peter
description: A section of residents of Usoma-Korando-Nawa-Kogony villages in Kisumu County’s Central Kisumu ward are appealing to area leaders to join hands and construct the Nawa Bridge for improved accessibil...
articleBody:
A section of residents of Usoma-Korando-Nawa-Kogony villages in Kisumu County’s Central Kisumu ward are appealing to area leaders to join hands and construct the Nawa Bridge for improved accessibility.

Speaking to Hivisasa.com on Wednesday, the residents said that the initial bridge which was constructed by the Kenya Rural Roads Authority (KERRA) has since collapsed forcing them to cross the bridge along Lake Victoria’s hippo and crocodile infested waters using boats.

According to residents led by Magnum Environmental Network chairman Michael Nyaguti, the bridge that was constructed during former President Mwai Kibaki and former Prime Minister Raila Odinga’s coalition government has over the years been washed away due to the increase of water levels in Lake Victoria.

The bridge is along the Usoma-Genge road.

“This bridge was constructed by KERRA during the coalition government but it was not done up to the standard. The engineers put up small culverts instead of putting up a full bridge or a box bridge,” said Nyaguti.

The residents estimates indicate that close to 200 people use the bridge on a daily basis to go to hospital in Usoma, and shop and market at the Otonglo market centre.

Currently, one has to use a boat in order to cross the bridge, with boat operators charging between Sh10 and Sh50 for each cross over.

“School going children cannot use this route from Usoma to Nawa. The government should help us by constructing this bridge,” said Hellen Achieng Odhiambo.

Her sentiments were echoed by Maurice Otieno who said the collapse of the bridge has hampered many social activities in the villages.

“We appeal for the construction of this bridge. Let the national government, county government, Kisumu West MP Olago Aluoch and area MCA Judith Ogaga act on our pleas,” said Otieno.

A few metres from the Nawa Bridge, water from the Lake Victoria has blocked off the road behind the Kisumu International Airport (KIA) making it impassable.

Residents are forced to wade through the waters in order to access neighbouring villages, given the fact that the Airport fence borders the Lake.

“Here the road should be raised so that when waves from Lake Victoria come, the water does not block off the road,” suggested Nyaguti.

headline: Uhuru: I will not support anyone in 2022
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta has said that he will not support any presidential candidate in 2022.Speaking in Nyandarua County during an inspection of projects on Friday, Uhuru said no one shoul...
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta has said that he will not support any presidential candidate in 2022.

Speaking in Nyandarua County during an inspection of projects on Friday, Uhuru said no one should depend on him for support come 2022.

“Anyone vying in the 2022 elections will fight for their space and should not expect me to support them," President Uhuru said.

The commander in chief however, urged politicians to stop politicking and focus on development as the time for politics will come.

Uhuru was disappointed with the fact that, during the inspection, he came to find out that some houses that were supposed to have been connected with electricity have not yet been connected.

Due to the failure of his representatives, President Uhuru promised to be going by himself to check the completion of projects.

“Let’s stop politics and focus on development because that is what our people need. I came here to see myself whether the people in this region had been connected to the national grid as alleged by the people I had sent here.

“But those houses there, why are they not yet connected? I will not be sending people anymore, I will come by myself,” he said.

headline: Kalonzo hails Uhuru over fight against corruption
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: Wiper Party Leader Stephen Kalonzo Musyoka has hailed President Uhuru Kenyatta's effort in the war against corruption. Speaking during Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) rally in Kitui County...
articleBody:
Wiper Party Leader Stephen Kalonzo Musyoka has hailed President Uhuru Kenyatta's effort in the war against corruption.

ADVERTISEMENT

Speaking during Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) rally in Kitui County on Saturday, Kalonzo said that President Kenyatta deserves credit because of his commitment to protect public resources from looters.

The Former Vice President argued that Uhuru has decided to wield the sword against individuals who are accused of graft, adding that he is not looking back at all.

"I want to congratulate President Uhuru Kenyatta on his stand against corruption. He has taken out the sword. Ukiguzwa usimlilie Rais Uhuru #BBIInKitui," he said.

On Saturday, Uhuru asked corrupt governors not to drag his name in their woes. The Head of state asked the governors to come forth and clear their names instead of sideshows.

“Whoever has misused money meant to benefit members of the public must pay in a hard way,” he said.

The President has also vowed that he will not end his friendship with ODM leader Raila Amolo Odinga until he makes Kenya a better place. The President noted that he is committed to achieving the Big Four Agenda before he leaves office.

headline: I no longer trust anyone, says agitated Uhuru
author: Adonijah Nziwa
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta has said that he will supervise some of the projects he has initiated in Mt Kenya because he doesn’t not trust those he has tasked with the job. Speaking in Kinangop...
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta has said that he will supervise some of the projects he has initiated in Mt Kenya because he doesn’t not trust those he has tasked with the job.

Speaking in Kinangop on Friday, Uhuru said that he is committed to ensuring that he achieves the Big Four agenda before the end of his tenure in office.

The head of state said that he had trusted some government officials but nothing much has been forthcoming from the projects while the general public is eagerly waiting for change.

“I no longer trust anyone,” said the visibly infuriated Uhuru.

Uhuru compared the leaders he used to send to the ground to hyenas after they failed to deliver on their mandate in the long run. He lamented that some of the leaders are doing all these things for their personal gains when the general public is faulting him.

“Those I used to send to represent me and ensure that development projects are on the right track started behaving like hyenas and doing their own things to enrich themselves. Let no one cheat you; from today, I am not sending anyone to help me. I’ll do it on my own,” he said.
